p: De Sousa et al. (2016) [ 52] investigated the EO of Mentha crispa L. and its main constituents (rotundifolone and four related p-menthane monoterpenes) against T. brucei trypomastigotes. The essential oil, the compounds rotundifolone and perillyl aldehyde presented a dose-dependent action and identical 50% growth inhibitory concentration (GI 50) of 0.3 Âµg/mL.
